statement:
For every measurable function $f \colon [0,\infty) \to \mathbb{C}$, if
there exists a real number $t_0$ such that
$$\int_0^\infty e^{-st_0} |f(s)| \, ds$$ converges, then the Laplace
transform $\mathcal{L}(f)$ is a well-defined function from
$\{t \in \mathbb{C} \mid \Re t > t_0 \}$ to $\mathbb{C}$. Furthermore,
the Laplace transform function is analytic.
